alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Butler (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 5:04AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following county, Columbiana. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Allegheny, Beaver and Butler. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell earlier due to thunderstorms. The heavy rain has ended, though urban and small stream flooding is still expected due to runoff from the heavy rain. Between 1 and 2.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Monaca, Shaler Township, Plum, Hampton Township, Harrison Township, Economy, Ambridge, Wexford, Oakmont, New Brighton, Fox Chapel, Beaver, Tarentum, Calcutta and Baden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
